newsitem.title: UK: ATHLETICS-GUNNELL MAY CONTINUE FOR TWO MORE YEARS.
newsitem.headline: ATHLETICS-GUNNELL MAY CONTINUE FOR TWO MORE YEARS.

text.p: Former Olympic 400 metres hurdles champion Sally Gunnell said on Wednesday she may keep competing until 1998, taking her up to the Commonwealth Games in Kuala Lumpur.
The 30-year-old Briton, who almost quit the sport after limping out of the Atlanta Olympics with an ankle injury, said she would definitely make a bid to regain the world title in Athens next August.
"The next few months will tell me how things are progressing," she said. "If I get to the new year and I'm fit and hurdling, then I'll gear up for another summer on the track.
"And if that goes well, who knows? I might go on for another year after that."
